bow: just so you do think when your child is 18 that you are done with being mom have children and most of them grown up am more than likely the age of your mothers tonight my 23 year old who still lives with me because my house is huge and would get lonely comes home from work had made salmon loaf and salad for dinner and it was ready when he came in the house he is hungry then he says he is meeting friend at local market so he leaves then the calls begin he wants me to make him corned beef and cabbage but he does want just any corned beef he wants it from scratch and he imagines that can make this in the pressure cooker corned beef from scratch takes week just to brine the meat sadly he knows can make it do have part of the brining ingredients on hand he begins to call and text asking what need then he gets irritated and wo answer the phone when call him back he comes home from the market with 30 worth of usda choice brisket one head of cabbage and bag of red potatoes that all he flings the brisket on the kitchen counter and says do what you want with it so brown the brisket cut up an onion mince cloves of garlic and throw that in the pressure cooker with water and package of lipton onion soup mix cut up some potatoes for mash and set them on the stove with some water can hear the pressure cooker down there making its hissing noises right now he is not going to get any food until about 10 pm because he came back at 7:45 am not complaining because as someone that is on the other end of where you all with babies are love the holy living hell out of my kids see what all the hard work has produced see the kids that work hard have gone to school and act like sensible adult human beings see the kids that they laid on my stomach after labor that watched take their first steps learn new things every day the kids that taught to read and forced to practice their instruments and finally see what all that hard work is for have seen them pull away gradually on their way to adulthood and it was painful at times watching them make stupid mistakes bringing down the hammer on discipline letting them take responsibility for their actions have watched them become individuals they surely did turn out like expected in any way and honestly never tried to force them to but sometimes kid of mine wants dinner another kid will call me and ask me how made that incredible pot roast or chicken one of them will call and ask how to get out stain from work shirt and know that until my last breath that am always going to be there for them not only when they need me but when they want me being parent is 24 full time career and sometimes when you are in the thick of it you feel like you want to scream some days they will drive you nuts and some days they will make you so happy you want to cry it kind of love that you do know until you have it *that* you have it so the next time you are walking the floor with colicky baby or wiping the spit up off that dress that has to be dry cleaned that every moment with those selfish little beasts is precious that some day you will watch your kid get diploma it over in an instant *i swear it you will be so busy you wo even notice the passage of time but every story you read to them every dinner you made every shirt you washed will become part of them and they will still look to you for support and comfort you wo be forgotten so do your best every day 24 and *still* rely on my mom for all kinds of things honestly do know what do if did have her if demanded specific meal from my mother she kick me out of the house do treat her like servant or personal chef oi if demanded my mom stay up until 10pm making me dinner at that age she would have laughed in my face not sure what that says about her deleted wish had mom like you my husband my mo daughter and live with her because of financial issues spent all day taking care of my daughter with my back killing me and my husband at work and she and her husband would even buy me wendy when they were getting it not to mention she charges us almost more rent than we can afford ca even imagine doing that to my daughter wow you sound like an amazing woman wish more parents were like you have friend whose parents do seem to get this 26 and mother but that does mean wont always want and need my mommy in fact probably call her even more now that am fumbling my way through motherhood deleted my kid is if does want what cook and asks for something else laugh in her face not *really* but sure as hell do make anything else not sure what this says about me as mother thank you so much love my mother because she is my best friend and always will be there for me when need it my little one is almost year and half she was born on my mothers birthday and will never forget how happy my mom was when called her and said need to go to the hospital the pain was insane but my mom was there and was by my side when needed her when my lil screamer calmed down she was and still is the most beautiful thing have ever seen could have gotten through those nine months or that day with out my mom just hope she knows how much love her and appreciate everything she has done for me and my husband and our daughter this comforts me and makes me smile about to have little boy of my own and just ca wait to take care of him and love him it scary sometimes but know that my mom now grandma will be there to support love me always so your *adult* son acts like real ass to you and demands you make him his favorite dinner and you just keel know this post is about loving your kids and it sure seems you do but something must have gone bit wrong somewhere for your son to have an attitude and you to just cave into it just because you are his mommy no matter how much you love someone or how much your birthed them you really should let them walk all over you my kids are not yet in primary school but sincerely doubt you are anywhere near as old as my mother given that she 70 that she has spine it says that you re standing your ground which is key to discipline if they win once they always win if they re hungry they ll eat what served if my kids do like what served for dinner they are welcome to go hungry it not like go out of my way to make things they hate that is true lived with her for about year when was 26 usually made dinner but if she made it ate what was served and when it was served and said thank you for it lol that what got from this post too she totally loves her kids obviously but her kids should respect their mother would never be so bratty to my mum and demand her to make food that hard and inconvenient after already rejecting meal same if my parents are having family dinner the my mom or dad cooks for everyone beyond that us kids 17 18 and 21 are on our own we also get special birthday dinners where we get to request what we want so there that guess haha just ca imagine asking my mother to make me dinner sometimes wish my mom had been bit more nurturing but never in million years would treat her the way op described being treated if wanted that meal so badly that late at night mom would explain to me how to do it myself understand do am younger mom with year old and year old but am the youngest of four and learned so much from my now passed mom she was nurturing and caring of all things and people kept waiting for the part of the story where she puts the pot roast on the stoop with the rest of his belongings she sounds like verbally abused servant keep my list of goals for my kids at the forefront of my mind at all times ultimately want to raise these kids into responsible and kind adults that man sounds like neither of those things of course he could ve just had terribly bad day and is typically so abusive but still ca fathom why she actually bow to his demands of course will still be their mom after they turn 18 but will done raising them and will most certainly not be their personal chef sure ll cook their favorite meals on special occassions but they have gotten away with *demanding* that do anything for them since they were 22 and live in an apartment on my own and have been doing so since my parents kicked me out on my 18th birthday my mom never packed my lunch past kindergarten and she never made special dinner for anyone grew up very independent and have had any issues thus far in the real world hate it when run into people my age who ca take care of themselves its really sad my parents did the same thing eat what was made or do eat am the least picky eater of all of my friends and the most likely to try something new same with my older sister and little brother my little sister is another story she sulked at the table and there were many times she chose not to eat she certainly did starve and now she is just bit of picky eater well this does not make me feel warm and fuzzy at all my children are and and do accept that kind of treatment from them now they are my children and love them and like cooking for them but expect them to ask politely for what they want accept my limitations and be grateful for what can do for them feel really badly for any woman or man your son eventually lives with this is no way to treat the person you love who usually prepares meals for household motherhood certainly is lifetime job but not lifetime of accepting year old antics from grown up deleted these were my thoughts exactly found it sad not sweet and your mom would have been doing you service part of good parenting big part is teaching your kids to be independent and self reliant agreed 20 and now mother myself ve lived on my own since graduated high school hate when meet people my age who ca even do their own laundry let alone live at home rent free or have their parents wait on them hand amp foot we always say you get what you get and you do throw fit said to my ds yesterday he did like what gave him for snack and he replied get what get and do throw fit somehow when read the op heard mrs wolowitz in my head howie do you want should make the corned beef or the brisket if pulled that crap with my mom she have laughed in my face loving your kids is not the same as being doormat my son will always be welcome in my home and will always help him but sometimes helping means saying no wouldnt have shifted my butt till got please some respect and few signs of appreciation and in my house if my daughter throws anything on table floor or counter in temper it goes straight in the bin we say that here tell my kids they are perfectly welcome to choose what we eat when they buy the food and cook it when was 21 still lived at home got into an arguement with my mom about her not paying my car insurance for me had job and said fuck you she kicked me out of the house changed the locks did not pay my car insurance had to pull up my big girl panties and find place to live good on her deserved it learned good lesson and would have done the same simple solution to that move out life is hard and finances can get tangled up but if you need to lower your living standards get roommates live in low income housing until you find your feet there is always an alternative so do feel trapped there and whine about not getting wendy frugal can help you live on dime check it out what in the world my mother would kick me out if acted like that and do blame her do this too like to think of it as training my son to eat anything in case he ever gets stranded in the woods or something he going to have to eat bugs and dead squirrels and there is going to be anyone around to make him anything else so eat your squirrel on stick yup if was her would ve eaten it in front of him and not let him have any same with my mother however when found myself back at home at 20 pregnant and single she was the only one that was there for me she would make me potato pancakes at am because had craving she would rub lotion on my belly if it got itchy now my daughter is and she is the most loving grandma ever my mom just got diagnosed with cancer this year and is staying strong and fighting it simply for my daughter she can not stand the thought of leaving her good momma love my mom in my thirties but she still make me cinnamon toast if was sick but because love my mom would never ever consider asking her to to make something else particularly something involved expensive time consuming that would keep her up until 10 pm and if she wanted to do something like that for me certainly would fling the groceries on the counter rudely and then leave her in the kitchen good grief feel little bit like there line between loving and supporting and comforting your kids and being slave to them know myself and know would probably give in and make treats or occasionally cook small second meal but hope to heck do allow my kid to *expect* it think he entitled to it or be obnoxious in the process the obnoxiousness gets me and maybe it just written badly but if someone no matter how much loved them was that grumpy and entitled about food expected to make to fling the ingredients on the counter and be huffy when told to do what want with it might well say oh ok *want* to put this in the fridge and go take bath thanks good night hope it was just written badly and your son is more grateful and helpful than what reading here why the hell did this get downvoted so much first heard it when was volunteering in prek class at ds preschool was like well that totally makes sense it not easy being mom if it was dads would do it there are lots of dads out there that are far better parents than many moms my husband is an incredible dad and being good father is in no way easy or any easier than being good mother come on didnt downvote myself but maybe because even though 90 of it is just fine she ends by saying men are incapable of being fathers as seperated single mother with an ex that is an amazing father find that offensive sounds like your mom is trying to teach you how to get back on your feet agreed my husband is technically father yet but he us wonderful dad to my kids the funny this is he *can* take care of himself he has been doing his own laundry since he was 10 all of my kids are awesome cooks but then they were raised by chef my son also has his own little dinner parties where he cooks everything himself he is the only kid of mine that would trust to send to the store to make wine pairing for me he pays his own way he fixes things around the house when they break he takes out the trash cans and fixes the car he great young man with girlfriend he has had for three years that he treats really well he is having any trouble with the real world at all in fact he has been promoted to management at the two places he has worked since he was 16 and he has only worked at two places unlike lot of 23 year olds but guess some days you just want heaping dish of mom and when he does he brings the ingredients home and pay for them himself am sorry your mom did pack your lunch that was one of my favorite things to do when sent my kids to school home schooled them for years took great joy in making sure each kid had their special favorite things am sorry your mom never made your favorite food or gave you special day am sorry they kicked you out when you were 18 am 51 and still fabulous what made this evening so particularly amusing is that he never has he does walk on me at all he is really respectful of women as are all of my boys raised by divorced mom he is actually quite protective of me the other night my sister and took off to visit friend when he got home was here and he called to make sure was ok got ta say as someone that has both genders of children boys are for mommy my daughter she is all about her dad it been hard raising them primarily on my own and walking that balance between making sure that they are kind and considerate while still making sure that they are momma boys have no idea what did that was right but they are some awesome young men ah see understand that now kinda read over that not sorry at all self reliant and take care of myself ve had three jobs and worked two of them at the same time had one job for four years and another for three years and the third one for nine months before the company outsourced my department pay for 500 month apartment car car insurance pay for my own clothes groceries utilities my dog etc so really not impressed by 23 year old that ca live on his own but is responsible enough to buy groceries did really *want* to get married and have kids when was in college doing this really derailed my career plans did mind getting married but my father had massive coronary months after got married and almost died had an older brother from my dad first marriage but for all intents and purposes was pretty much an only child and adopted got pregnant while my dad was recovering my first son was born year and 11 days after my first anniversary was latchkey kid my parents both worked from the time was my mom could really cook anything my parents were drunks and abusive but there were always these flashes that made me realize that they were products of their upbringing and occasionally tried to do the best that they could they were hypercritical and very negative with me the moment that my first child was laid on my stomach and looked in his clear grey eyes knew that my child life were going to be different than mine was was going to be that mom that was nurturing was going to read them stories and bake them cookies was not going to beat them literally or beat them down emotionally had to change had to forgive my own parents had to figure out who was had to become altruistic and learn not to be selfish had to figure out how to love everyone and not only my children in totally different way had to take hard look at myself and realize that needed to wipe that slate clean because you ca change or control things that happened to you in the past but you can control how you respond to it and make choices about what is going to happen in the future as for your one child theory hated being essentially an only child was alternately either being spoiled rotten beaten or neglected felt very alone love my older brother but was never close to him and do speak to him because his wife is christian fundamentalist terror and he is completely pussy whipped was lucky as an adoptee my birth mother and found each other now have siblings the parents that raised me are both dead now but have family that loves and accepts me my friends have always been fiercely loved and like family to me while think my oldest wishes he was an only child my kids are close with each other it makes me feel better to know when am gone that they will have each other they wo be alone and incidentally that thrown together brisket was awesome have leftovers for lunch today hope your son at least washed the dishes dude my mom is nearly 60 how old do you think *we* are my mum was an advocate of you eat what put in front of you even if bought some of the things for another meal if expected her to cook it for me would have been handed my own apron and told to get on with it my sister washed the dishes we have deal she will wash the dishes if cook she not only does know how to cook she does even want to learn am 51 my oldest son is 27 it not that simple live in california we ve been on our own we just moved back home there is 10 year waiting list for lower income homes apartments here wo rent without good credit and ours is in the shitter from medical expenses we never live beyond our means and our daughter comes first my mom is barely recovered alcoholic user and made my life hell as child have no relationship with her she extremely selfish super religious and ca see past her own opinions to save her life we would move in with my husband parents if they were in the process of losing their house did think would have to explain myself over stupid comment all of you with awesome moms with valuable lessons and virtues to pass on to you that awesome do not can guarantee you she not my boys pretty much ate anything you put in front of them my daughter was totally different had to pay her quarter to try new things which she would usually like once she tried it would ve been done when he tossed the groceries on the counter with that do whatever attitude actually no would ve been done when he asked for meal that takes week to make wtf mother kitchen slave since many of us seem to have toddler age kids she probably thinks we re in our mid 20s 31 my mom is 55 if this is all true am not sure why you chose to share story on the internet where he acts like an ungrateful brat and you respond by catering to his whims with smile on your face we only know of you what we see here and you do not present either your son or yourself in positive light at all in this post far from being heartwarming it made me hope very much that my daughter will cook for herself at 23 instead of demanding separate late night meal and throwing groceries down on the counter and saying do what you want with it would like to add that she kicked me out of the house originally at 18 unless paid 600 mo for my room and constantly said to my brother and done being mom she was sober yet at the time guess that why this post struck close to my heart how can mother say done being mom you re never done being mom the moment my beautiful daughter was born knew she would have my heart and support forever we re making our way through our debt and getting out on our own know that one day she going to be an adult and ll always be there to help her and guide her on her path to being successful member of society my son is like that he loves to try new food my daughter does almost 29 my mom was 29 when she had me apparently my mom is old sorry your experience with mothers is terrible possibly even abusive but you are not chained to your past nor are you chained to that house life goes to shit but there is always wiggle room for 600 month you could at least find studio even in one of the larger cities there is always another way you are as helpless as you think sommiel love you you are my mom but the mom hope to be am glad thank you for clearing that up for us best comment yet this is just rude am 16 year old boy and could never treat my mother like that stop making him dinner at ridiculous times of the night he 23 and should be making his own goddamn meals you win the most awesome parent ever award that simultaneously hilarious and genius aww thank you achievement unlocked awesomepurplewizard for everyone who downvoted me for it not easy being mom if it was dads would do it is line from golden girls know that many fathers are amazing parents and am sorry if offended anyone for it was just quoting great show that love it says that you re not teaching your child to be spoiled and be grateful for what they have it says you re good mother if pulled that crap at that age my mom would have told me to go fuck myself and rightly so if my kid pulls that stuff at that age she ll get go fuck yourself also appalling behavior from grown man
